 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">
approved, the inclusion of the audited financial statements in the annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 filed with the SEC. The audit committee has also
selected Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young LLP as independent registered public accountants for 2015. The board has proposed that the stockholders ratify this selection at the annual meeting. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">James H. Quigley, Chairman </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Rodney F. Chase </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Harvey Golub </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Edith E. Holiday </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Dr.&nbsp;Kevin&nbsp;O. Meyers </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Fredric G.
Reynolds </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">William G. Schrader </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><I>Risk Management Oversight </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">In the normal course of its business, the company is exposed to a variety of risks, including market risks relating to changes in commodity prices, interest rates and currencies, technical risks affecting
the company&#146;s resource base, political and regulatory risks and credit and investment risks. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The company
operates a risk control program under the direction of its chief risk officer and through its corporate risk policy, which senior management has approved. The company is continuing to develop and implement an enterprise risk program across the
company to strengthen the consistency of risk consideration in making business decisions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The audit committee
of the board of directors has been delegated primary responsibility for oversight of the company&#146;s risk management practices. At least annually, the chief risk officer presents a comprehensive review of the company&#146;s corporate risk policy
to the audit committee, discussing the risk control organization and risk control practices. The audit committee will also receive updates at other meetings during the year on any particular matters relating to risk controls that management believes
needs to be brought to the attention of the committee. In addition, the full board of directors has oversight of the company&#146;s risk management policies with an emphasis on understanding the key enterprise risks affecting the company&#146;s
business and the ways in which the company attempts to prudently mitigate such risks, to the extent reasonably practicable and consistent with the company&#146;s long-term strategies. The chief risk officer reviews the enterprise risk program with
the board periodically. In addition, the company conducts an annual risk assessment to determine the extent, if any, to which the company&#146;s compensation programs and practices may create incentives for excessive risk-taking. For a discussion of
this assessment, see &#147;Compensation and Risk&#148; on page 55. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">21 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><A NAME="toc859837_6"></A>Section&nbsp;16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Section&nbsp;16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;)
requires the company&#146;s directors, certain of its officers and persons who beneficially own more than 10% of the company&#146;s common stock to file initial reports of ownership and reports of changes in ownership with the SEC. Based solely on
the company&#146;s review of copies of such reports, and on written representations from such reporting persons, the company believes that in 2014 all such reporting persons filed the required reports on a timely basis in accordance with
Section&nbsp;16(a), except for one Form 3 filing by Mr.&nbsp;Eugene&nbsp;W. Goodwillie, Jr., which was filed late due to an administrative error. The filing obligation arose when the beneficial ownership of certain trusts and related entities for
which Mr.&nbsp;Goodwillie serves as trustee or director, but in which Mr.&nbsp;Goodwillie has no pecuniary interest, exceeded the 10% threshold solely by reason of the reduction in outstanding shares due to the repurchase of shares by the company
pursuant to a board authorized stock repurchase program. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">22 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><A NAME="toc859837_7"></A>Ownership of Voting Securities by Certain Beneficial Owners
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The following table sets forth, as of March&nbsp;4, 2015, for Messrs. Hess, Brady, Kean and Goodwillie,
and as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 for Elliott Associates, L.P. and BlackRock, Inc., information as to the ownership of more than 5% of any class of the company&#146;s voting securities by beneficial owners known by the company to hold more than 5% of
any such class: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="92%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">


<TR>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;of&nbsp;beneficial&nbsp;ownership(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

which has sole voting and dispositive power with respect to such shares and (y)&nbsp;12,220,090 shares, including 650,000 shares underlying currently exercisable options, collectively held by Elliott International, L.P. and Elliott International
Capital Advisors, Inc., both of which share voting and dispositive power of such shares. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(j)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This amount includes (x)&nbsp;12,655,214 shares over which Blackrock, Inc. has sole voting power and (y)&nbsp;15,375,177 shares over which
BlackRock, Inc. has sole dispositive power. The shares are held by subsidiaries of Blackrock, Inc. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">24 </FONT></P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>O<A NAME="toc859837_8"></A>wnership of Equity Securities by Management </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The table below sets forth as to each director, nominee and named executive officer, and all directors, nominees and
executive officers as a group, information regarding their ownership of equity securities of the company on March&nbsp;4, 2015. The persons listed below have sole voting and investment power as to all shares indicated except as set forth in the
footnotes to the table. Where no information appears in the column &#147;Percent of outstanding shares of common stock owned,&#148; the securities held represent less than 1% of the common stock outstanding. </FONT></P>

escrow under the second amended and restated 1995 LTI plan or the 2008 LTI plan, as amended, or both, for Mr.&nbsp;Goodell, 158,505&nbsp;shares held in escrow under these plans for Mr.&nbsp;Hess, 70,943&nbsp;shares held in escrow under these plans
for Mr.&nbsp;Hill, 36,664&nbsp;shares held in escrow under the these plans for Mr.&nbsp;Rielly, 28,431 shares held in escrow under these plans for Mr.&nbsp;Turner and 401,394&nbsp;shares held in escrow under these plans for all executive officers
and directors as a group. As to these shares, these individuals and the group have voting power but not dispositive power. Holders of stock options do not have the right to vote or any other right of a stockholder with respect to shares of common
stock underlying such options until they are exercised. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

2014 to Mr.&nbsp;Checki, which, in each case, were fully vested on the grant date. The aggregate grant date value for 2014 stock awards was computed in accordance with ASC 718. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

and dental benefits and, (ii)&nbsp;for Mr.&nbsp;Schrader, $5,816 in partial year medical and dental benefits and, (iii)&nbsp;for Mr.&nbsp;Reynolds, $1,034 in dental benefits. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Krenicki resigned from the board effective May&nbsp;1, 2014. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Each director who was not an employee of the company or any of its subsidiaries receives an annual cash retainer of
$110,000 for membership on the board of directors and the independent chairman of the board receives an additional annual cash retainer of $185,000. Directors receive an additional annual cash fee of $25,000 for service on the audit committee and
$10,000 for service on each of the other committees of the board of directors on which such director serves. The chairperson of the audit committee receives an annual cash fee of $30,000 and the chairperson of each of the other board committees
receives an annual cash fee of $15,000. In addition, each non-employee director receives shares of fully vested common stock constituting approximately $175,000 in value on the date of award. These awards are made from shares purchased by the
company in the open market. For 2014, Mr.&nbsp;Krenicki and Mr.&nbsp;Checki received pro-rated board and committee retainers based on their length of service on the board and Mr.&nbsp;Krenicki&#146;s service on the compensation and management
development committee in 2014, and Mr.&nbsp;Checki received a pro-rated stock award based on his length of service on the board in 2014. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">26 </FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><U>Compensation Discussion and Analysis</U> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">This Compensation Discussion and Analysis (&#147;CD&amp;A&#148;) explains the key elements of our executive compensation program and 2014 compensation decisions for our named executive officers
(&#147;NEOs&#148;). The Compensation and Management Development Committee of our Board of Directors (the &#147;compensation committee&#148; or the &#147;committee&#148;), with input from its independent compensation consultant, oversees these
programs and determines compensation for our NEOs. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For fiscal year 2014, our NEOs were: </FONT></P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">page&nbsp;33</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><A HREF="#tx859837_309">Compensation Committee Report</A></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">page&nbsp;46</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><A NAME="tx859837_301"></A>Executive Summary </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Summary of Hess&#146; Business</I></B>.<B><I></I></B> Hess Corporation is a leading global independent energy
company engaged in the exploration and production of crude oil and natural gas. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">In 2014, the board of
directors and management team substantially completed the process of transforming Hess into a more focused pure play exploration and production (&#147;E&amp;P&#148;) company. This multi-year, strategic transformation was designed to drive cash
generative growth and sustainable returns to stockholders by focusing on lower risk, higher growth unconventional assets, exploiting existing offshore assets and executing a smaller, more targeted exploratory program. The transformation plan
included fully exiting the company&#146;s downstream businesses, including its refining, energy marketing, terminal, retail and energy trading operations, as well as the sale of mature or lower margin exploration and production assets
internationally and domestically. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Corporate Performance Overview</I></B>. 2014 was a strong year for
Hess. For the three-year period ending December&nbsp;31, 2014, our total shareholder return (&#147;TSR&#148;), which is the change in stock price plus reinvested dividends, was top quartile compared to our 2014 and 2015 peer<B><I> </I></B>companies.
We also substantially completed execution of our strategic plan to transition to a pure<B><I> </I></B></FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">27 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>
</I></B>play E&amp;P company. The resulting smaller, restructured organization, combined with a strong balance sheet, leaves the company better positioned for the lower oil price environment.
Select 2014 highlights are summarized below.<B><I> </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="98%"></TD></TR>


<TR BGCOLOR="#26962d">
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff"></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff">2014 Strategic Initiative Results</FONT></B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Focused Pure Play E&amp;P
Company</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Substantially completed execution of strategic plan to transition to a pure play E&amp;P company</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Completed sale of retail marketing business for $2.8 billion, exceeding market expectations</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sold Utica dry gas acreage &#150; approximately 77,000 net acres &#150; for $1.1 billion</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Progressed monetization of our Bakken midstream assets</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#edf9d8">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Total Hess Asset
Sales</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Completed asset sales totaling $5.9 billion during 2014, including sale of our retail marketing business and assets in Indonesia and Thailand. In total, our asset sale program has
generated approximately $13.4 billion since the beginning of 2013</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Stockholder Returns</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Increased $4 billion share repurchase program authorization to $6.5 billion, with approximately
$3.75&nbsp;billion of shares purchased in 2014 ($5.26 billion since the program commenced in 2013)</FONT></P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff"></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff">2014 Operational Results</FONT></B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Production and
Reserves</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Production averaged 318&nbsp;thousand barrels of oil equivalent (&#147;BOE&#148;) per day on a pro forma basis, excluding divestitures and Libya</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Replaced 158% of production, at a finding, development and acquisition cost of approximately $28.75 per barrel of oil equivalent</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At year end, our proved reserves were 1.4 billion barrels of oil equivalent and our reserve life was 11.7 years</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#edf9d8">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Cost Reduction / Spending
Efficiency</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Delivered budgeted Bakken capital spend of $2.2 billion, and continued to drive down Bakken drilling and completion costs</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Delivered below budget total capital spend ($5.6 billion)</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Finance</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Strong financial position with $2.4 billion of cash on our balance sheet and a debt to capitalization
ratio of 21% at year end</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT

continuing operations before changes in operating assets and liabilities</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(1)</SUP></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></P></TD></TR>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">28 </FONT></P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Summary of Hess&#146; 2014 Executive Compensation Program</I></B>. A
summary of our executive compensation program during 2014 is provided below. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="3%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="46%"></TD></TR>


<TR BGCOLOR="#26962d">
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff"></FONT>
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff">Compensation Philosophy</FONT></B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 2'">&#161;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Generally, we target total direct compensation (salary, annual bonus and long-term incentives) within a competitive range of market
median.</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 2'">&#161;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sustained performance
may be recognized in individual pay components, and pay will vary above or below target based primarily on enterprise and, to a lesser degree, individual performance outcomes.</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 2'">&#161;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Annual incentive plan was redesigned for
2014, to provide greater emphasis on formulaic enterprise results and decreased weighting on individual results.</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 2'">&#161;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Long-term incentives are delivered using different types of awards to balance absolute and relative performance, over varying time
horizons, and retention considerations.</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 2'">&#161;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Mix of long-term awards was modified for
2014, to increase the weighting on performance-contingent awards from 50% to 80% based on grant date target value.</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#26962d">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff"></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff">Compensation Element</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff"></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff">2014 Result</FONT></B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#edf9d8">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Base Salary</B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 2'">&#161;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fixed rate of pay</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>No increase for 3 of 5 NEOs, including the CEO.</B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">One NEO received an increase reflective of enhanced role and responsibilities, and one NEO was new to our proxy officer group for
2014.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Annual Incentive Plan (&#147;AIP&#148;)</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 2'">&#161;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payout from 0%-200% of target</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 2'">&#161;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payout based on enterprise performance
factor <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">(0%-175%</FONT> of target) and an individual performance modifier of 0% to +25% of target</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 2'">&#161;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2014 Enterprise performance metrics included:</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1. Environment, health and safety</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2. Proved reserve additions</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3. Production</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4. Controllable operated cash costs</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5. E&amp;P capital
and exploratory spend</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6. Cash return on capital employed</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>CEO target award decreased by $1 million in 2014</B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Enterprise Result 135% of target.</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Individual modifiers for 3 of 5 NEOs resulted in no adjustment to enterprise results.
Two NEOs received adjustments of 4%.</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 2'">&#161;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based on evaluation of performance versus
pre-defined goals</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 2'">&#161;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Tempered to
reflect current lower oil price environment</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#edf9d8">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Long-term Incentives (&#147;LTI&#148;)</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#edf9d8">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 2'">&#161;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;60% Performance Share Units (&#147;PSUs&#148;); payout from <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">0%-200%</FONT> of target</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 2'">&#161;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;20% Stock Options; stock price must
appreciate for any value to be realized</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:'WINGDINGS 2'">&#161;</FONT>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;20% Restricted Stock</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>No increase in target grant date value of
2014 LTI awards for CEO. Corresponding increase to offset reduction in cash bonus target applies in 2015.</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Among other NEOs, increases averaged 12%. Actual grant date values of 2014 LTI awards for all NEOs were approximately 15% above target, reflecting strong 2013 performance.</B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">PSUs at-risk based on three-year TSR performance compared to peers.</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Payout of PSUs for the 2012-14 performance period was 200% of target, given top
quartile TSR performance versus peers.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Pay Mix</I></B>. The majority of NEO compensation is variable. For our CEO and other
NEOs, approximately 90% and 80%, respectively, on average, of 2014 target total direct compensation was variable. Variable pay directly ties their pay to company performance outcomes, both retrospectively and prospectively, including financial
results, strategic initiatives, and stock price performance. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">29 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">In March 2014, the committee decided to reduce Mr.&nbsp;Hess&#146; cash
bonus target for 2014 by $1 million and approved a corresponding increase in the value of his target LTI award in 2015 by $1 million. Accordingly the target annual bonus declined from 217% to 150% of salary &#150; from $3.25 to $2.25 million. The
result of this change in mix was to align a greater portion of Mr.&nbsp;Hess&#146; target total direct compensation with the company&#146;s long-term performance. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center">


<IMG SRC="g859837g21i30.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:8px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Pay vs. Performance Alignment (Realizable Compensation)</I></B>.&nbsp;A
comparison of realizable pay to target pay, based on the grant date opportunity, and TSR illustrates how performance outcomes have impacted pay over time. The graph below shows the average realizable pay of the CEO for each of the three-year periods
ending December&nbsp;31, 2012, 2013 and 2014, and the correlation with the indexed TSR of Hess common stock. As shown below, realizable CEO compensation is sensitive to TSR, indicating alignment with stockholder interests. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center">

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">30 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><A NAME="tx859837_302"></A>Strong 2014 Say on Pay Vote Result and Ongoing Stockholder Engagement
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">At our 2014 annual stockholders meeting, over 96% of votes cast supported Hess&#146; executive
compensation program, a significant improvement over 2013. We view this as an affirmation of our current pay practices. As a result, no significant changes were made to our NEO compensation program for 2015. However, we regularly engage stockholders
to discuss a variety of aspects of our business and welcome stockholder input and feedback. The &#147;say on pay&#148; vote serves as an additional tool to guide the board and the compensation committee in ensuring alignment of our executive
compensation programs with stockholder interests. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Specifically, we engage with our stockholders in order to
ensure we fully understand the factors they consider to be the most important when evaluating our executive compensation program. Before our 2014 annual meeting and continuing throughout 2014, our CEO and other members of senior management, at times
accompanied by our non-executive chairman, conducted a broad outreach effort which included nearly 72&nbsp;institutional stockholders representing&#151;in the aggregate&#151;over 37% of our outstanding shares. The purpose of this outreach was to
discuss and solicit stockholder views on our business plan, corporate governance and other matters of concern, including executive compensation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><A NAME="tx859837_303"></A>2015 Compensation Actions to Recognize Lower Commodity Price Environment </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Given the current lower oil and gas price environment, and our disciplined approach to executive compensation, the committee approved the following compensation actions for 2015: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">salaries were frozen at 2014 levels for our most senior leaders, including our NEOs, during 2015; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">despite strong 2014 enterprise and individual results, 2014 individual modifiers&#151;part of determining final annual incentive payments&#151;were
limited, with three NEOs receiving no adjustment and the remaining two NEOs receiving adjustments of 4%; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">annual incentive targets were frozen at 2014 levels for our most senior leaders, including our NEOs; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">grant date values of long-term incentive awards for each of our NEOs were reduced in 2015 compared to 2014 grant date values.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><A NAME="tx859837_304"></A>Total Compensation &#150; Objectives, Philosophy and Key Practices </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B></B><B><I>Objectives</I></B><B></B>. The objective of our executive compensation program is to attract and retain
talented executives and motivate them to achieve our business goals through a combination of cash and stock-based compensation. The principal elements of an executive&#146;s total compensation consist of: <B> </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">base salary, </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">cash bonus, and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">long-term incentives. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We also review other elements of compensation, including retirement benefits, life insurance, savings, health and welfare plans and other benefits offered to employees generally in order to evaluate the
entire compensation package offered to executives. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">31 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B></B><B><I>Compensation Philosophy</I></B><B></B>. Generally, we target
total direct compensation (salary, annual bonus and long-term incentives) within a competitive range of market median. Sustained performance may be recognized in individual pay components, and pay will vary above or below target based primarily on
actual enterprise performance and, to a lesser degree, individual performance. Variations in total direct compensation among the NEOs reflect differences in competitive pay for their respective positions as well as the size and complexity of the
business units or functions they oversee, the performance of those business units or functions, and individual performance. <B> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Key Compensation Practices</I></B>. Key executive compensation practices are summarized below. We believe these practices promote alignment with the interests of our stockholders.<B><I>
</I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="90%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="91%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:2px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#21a32b"><B><U>What We
Do</U></B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">
<TD HEIGHT="8" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">
<P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#21a32b"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#252;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Directly link pay to performance outcomes, operational results and stockholder returns</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">
<P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#21a32b"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#252;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Engage in ongoing dialogue with stockholders to incorporate feedback into our compensation programs</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">
<P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#21a32b"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#252;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Target total direct compensation (base salary / cash bonus / long-term incentives) within a competitive range of market
median</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">
<P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#21a32b"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#252;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Use a structured approach to CEO performance evaluation and related compensation decisions</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">
<P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#21a32b"><FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS">&#252;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #000000; padding-left:8px">

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">32 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><A NAME="tx859837_305"></A>2014 Total Direct Compensation </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We structure NEO total direct compensation so that the majority is delivered in the form of equity awards, in order to
provide incentives to work toward growth of long-term profitability that will enhance stockholder returns. We also structure NEOs&#146; cash compensation so that a significant portion is at risk under the company&#146;s annual incentive plan,
payable primarily based on enterprise results, and to a lesser degree individual performance. We further detail each component of total direct compensation below. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Base Salary</I></B>.&nbsp;&nbsp;We review base salaries annually, but we do not necessarily award salary increases
each year. In determining base salary levels for executive officers, the committee considers the following qualitative and quantitative factors: job level and responsibilities, relevant experience, individual performance, recent corporate and
business unit performance, internal equity and our objective of paying competitive total direct compensation if performance is met. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">From time to time base salaries may be adjusted other than as a result of an annual review in order to address competitive pressures or in connection with a promotion. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">33 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Annual Incentive Plan
(&#147;AIP&#148;)</I></B>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We establish a cash bonus target for each executive officer based upon his or her position within the company, corresponding responsibilities and competitive cash bonus opportunity for similar
positions in other companies. Final actual payouts may range from 0% to 200% of the target cash bonus opportunity based on actual enterprise and individual performance outcomes. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">$570,000</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">In March 2014, the committee decided to reduce Mr.&nbsp;Hess&#146; cash bonus target for
2014 by $1 million and approved a corresponding increase in the value of his target LTI award for 2015 by $1 million. Accordingly the target annual bonus declined from 217% to 150% of salary &#150; from $3.25 to $2.25 million. The result of this
change in mix was to align a greater portion of Mr.&nbsp;Hess&#146; target total direct compensation with the company&#146;s long-term performance. At the same time, the committee increased the target bonus opportunity for Mr.&nbsp;Hill from 95% to
130% of salary and Mr.&nbsp;Rielly from 65% to approximately 90% of salary. The changes for Mr.&nbsp;Hill and Mr.&nbsp;Rielly were approved to maintain alignment of their compensation with our compensation philosophy to target their compensation
within a competitive range of market median. The target bonus increases for Messrs. Hill and Rielly also took into account their respective increased responsibilities and roles within the company. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>2014 AIP Design</I></B>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The annual AIP payout for executive officers is primarily determined
based on enterprise performance results that align with the company&#146;s business strategy. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="50%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Capital and Exploratory
Spend</FONT></P></TD>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">34 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Payouts under the AIP depend on enterprise results, and payouts can range
from 0% to 175% of target. An individual performance multiplier can reduce the bonus down to zero or increase it by up to 25% of target based on actual individual performance results measured against pre-defined individual performance goals. There
will be no payout if the threshold level of enterprise performance is not achieved. The payout is capped at 200% of the target award. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>Illustration of 2014 AIP Design </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center">


<IMG SRC="g859837g72y12.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Actual Cash Bonus Awards</I></B>.&nbsp;&nbsp;The following table shows actual
performance as a percent of target based on the 2014 results for each component of the bonus, and the actual cash bonus award for each NEO. The following pages explain how the payouts on each component were determined. </FONT></P>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">%&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="5" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">1</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Total&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">135</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">%&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>Assessment of Individual Performance</I></B>.&nbsp;We assess individual performance
based on goals set at the beginning of each year, specific to each NEO. Following year end, achievement of these pre-defined individual goals is assessed. The CEO conducts performance reviews for the other NEOs and makes compensation recommendations
to the committee based on these reviews, with the committee making the final determination. The committee reviews the CEO&#146;s attainment of his individual performance objectives. This individual performance assessment for each NEO determines the
modifier used (if any) to influence the final payout of their annual cash bonus. This review can also influence the grant date value of LTI compensation and base salary adjustments for the subsequent year. The target LTI value for any NEO can be
adjusted down to zero or increased by up to +25%, given the result of each individual performance assessment. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">In March 2014, the committee approved the individual objectives for our CEO and for other NEOs. None of the objectives had
any specific weighting and are intended to be used together with other information the committee determines relevant to develop a holistic evaluation of individual performance. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">In the first quarter of 2015, the committee evaluated 2014 performance for each NEO against, among other factors, the
approved individual objectives. For Mr.&nbsp;Hess, the committee reviewed and considered his 2014 performance self-assessment. For each of the other NEOs, the </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">36 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">
committee reviewed their respective 2014 performance self-assessments, and considered Mr.&nbsp;Hess&#146; recommendation and summary of each of the other NEO&#146;s performance. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Specific items considered by the committee in its assessment of individual performance are outlined below. After
evaluating Mr.&nbsp;Hess&#146; performance on these criteria, the committee concluded that his 2014 performance exceeded expectations. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff"><B><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#ffffff">Performance vs. Goals for Our Chief Executive Officer:</FONT></B></FONT></TD></TR>


<TR BGCOLOR="#edf9d8">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Strategic Initiatives:</B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;-&nbsp;Substantially completed execution of strategic plan
&#150; transforming company into a more focused pure-play E&amp;P company &#150; &nbsp;resulting in strong balance sheet and better positioning the company for cash generative growth</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;-&nbsp;Completed $5.9 billion of asset sales, including
retail marketing business, which exceeded expectations ($2.8&nbsp;billion)</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="font-size:4px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Annual Operational Goals:</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;-&nbsp;Exceeded total production goal</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;-&nbsp;Exceeded goal for additions to proved reserves</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;-&nbsp;Delivered capital spend under budget</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;-&nbsp;Added to executive bench strength through multiple
senior executive hires, and strengthened leadership succession process</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#edf9d8">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B></B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B></B><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</B><B>Relative
Performance:</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;-&nbsp;TSR performance versus
peers for the three-year period ending December&nbsp;31, 2014 was 1</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">st</SUP></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> quartile compared to our 2014 and 2015 peers</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="2" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B></B><B>Corporate Reputation and Relationship Building:</B></FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-2.00em" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;-&nbsp;Continued broad outreach and communications effort with stockholders and other stakeholders</FONT></P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Messrs. Hill, Goodell, Rielly and Turner contributed to the positive 2014 outcomes listed
above. In addition, specific to each individual, the committee considered, among other things, the items listed below for each individual, as well as input from the CEO. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Mr.&nbsp;Hill delivered key business targets and major milestones set in his performance goals, oversaw significant
advances in lean methodology throughout the company&#146;s operations, particularly in the Bakken, recruited key executive talent for global exploration and drilling and developments and oversaw significant improvement in safety. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Mr.&nbsp;Goodell successfully restructured the external affairs function, improving the company&#146;s interaction with
stakeholders. He also led a project to enhance the capabilities and processes of the global compliance function, oversaw legal preparation for the initial public offering of Hess Midstream Partners LP (the &#147;MLP&#148;) and successfully managed
significant litigation to mitigate financial and operational impact on the company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Mr.&nbsp;Rielly played a
key role in the preparation and execution of a successful investor day. He advanced the MLP&#146;s organizational capability and leadership in preparation for its initial public offering. He also successfully transitioned the corporate tax and
accounting functions to Houston and managed significant international restructurings. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">37 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Mr.&nbsp;Turner successfully oversaw reduction in Bakken drilling and
completion costs, advanced decisions on acquisition and appraisal opportunities, established an enterprise leadership team to support the E&amp;P business and foster functional excellence, furthered initiatives on organizational effectiveness and
talent succession and sustained EHS improvements. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">After reviewing 2014 individual performance, including the
pre-defined individual performance goals and also considering the current lower oil and gas price environment, the committee determined to make no individual adjustment to bonus payments for Messrs.&nbsp;Hess, Goodell and Rielly. The committee
determined this action was appropriate despite the company having a strong performance year and each individual, overall, either meeting or exceeding individual performance expectations. The committee determined to make small positive adjustments to
Mr.&nbsp;Hill&#146;s bonus payment and to Mr.&nbsp;Turner&#146;s bonus payment, based on respective individual performance results. Although all of the NEOs met their individual performance goals, the committee determined it was appropriate to make
positive adjustments for Messrs. Hill and Turner because their contributions were more directly linked to the company&#146;s strong operational performance in 2014. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><I>LTI Program Structure.</I></B> Long-term Incentive (&#147;LTI&#148;) compensation is an important tool to drive
behavior that supports our business strategy. LTI compensation is also an important retention tool. As a result, LTI compensation represents the largest portion of each executive officer&#146;s target total direct compensation package. For 2014 LTI
awards, we modified our approach for NEOs by decreasing the weighting on time-based restricted stock, increasing the weighting on PSUs, and re-introducing stock options. This change increased the performance-based component of our LTI awards from
50% to 80%, based on grant date target value, which the committee believed would further support alignment of the interests of our senior-most management and stockholders. Payout of PSUs is contingent upon the company&#146;s TSR compared with that
of our peer companies, identified below, over a three-year period. In addition, our TSR must be positive during the three-year performance period for payout to exceed target, even if Hess outperforms peers. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="86%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="4" NOWRAP ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #21a32b; BORDER-TOP:2px solid #21a32b; padding-left:8px;border-bottom:1px solid #63ad05"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>2013</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #21a32b; BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #21a32b"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ROWSPAN="5"> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="justify">


<IMG SRC="g859837g65d94.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #21a32b; BORDER-TOP:2px solid #21a32b"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
