 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">76 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><A NAME="toc859837_14"></A>PROPOSAL 5: STOCKHOLDER PROPOSAL FOR PROXY ACCESS
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The company has received notice from the Comptroller of the City of New York, One Centre Street, Room 629,
New York, NY 10007, as custodian and trustee of the New York City Employees&#146; Retirement System, the New York City Fire Department Pension Fund, the New York City Teachers&#146; Retirement System, and the New York City Police Pension Fund, and
as custodian of the New York City Board of Education Retirement System (the &#147;Systems&#148;), each of which has continuously held more than $2,000 of the company&#146;s common stock since October&nbsp;22, 2013, of the Systems&#146; intention to
present the following resolution for action at the annual meeting. The proponents also furnished the supporting statement immediately following the resolution. Adoption of this proposal requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the shares
present in person or represented by proxy. Abstentions will be counted as present for purposes of this vote and therefore will have the same effect as a vote against this stockholder proposal. Broker non-votes will not be counted as present and are
not entitled to vote on the proposal. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PROPOSAL FOR PROXY ACCESS </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">RESOLVED, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Shareholders of Hess Corporation (the &#147;Company&#148;) ask the board of directors (the &#147;Board&#148;) to adopt, and present for shareholder approval, a &#147;proxy access&#148; by-law. Such a
by-law shall require the Company to include in proxy materials prepared for a shareholder meeting at which directors are to be elected the name, Disclosure and Statement (as defined herein) of any person nominated for election to the board by a
shareholder or group (the &#147;Nominator&#148;) that meets the criteria established below. The Company shall allow shareholders to vote on such nominee on the Company&#146;s proxy card. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The number of shareholder-nominated candidates appearing in proxy materials shall not exceed one quarter of the directors
then serving. This by-law, which shall supplement existing rights under Company by-laws, should provide that a Nominator must: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">have beneficially owned 3% or more of the Company&#146;s outstanding common stock continuously for at least three years before submitting the
nomination; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">give the Company, within the time period identified in its by-laws, written notice of the information required by the by-laws and any SEC rules
about (i)&nbsp;the nominee, including consent to being named in the proxy materials and to serving as director if elected; and (ii)&nbsp;the Nominator, including proof it owns the required shares (the &#147;Disclosure&#148;); and
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">certify that (i)&nbsp;it will assume liability stemming from any legal or regulatory violation arising out of the Nominator&#146;s communications
with the Company shareholders, including the Disclosure and Statement; (ii)&nbsp;it will comply with all applicable laws and regulations if it uses soliciting material other than the Company&#146;s proxy materials; and (iii)&nbsp;to the best of its
knowledge, the required shares were acquired in the ordinary course of business and not to change or influence control at the Company. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The Nominator may submit with the Disclosure a statement not exceeding 500 words in support of the nominee (the &#147;Statement&#148;). The Board shall adopt procedures for promptly resolving disputes
over whether notice of a nomination was timely, whether the Disclosure and Statement satisfy the by-law and applicable federal regulations, and the priority to be given to multiple nominations exceeding the one-quarter limit. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">77 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>SUPPORTING STATEMENT FROM STOCKHOLDER PROPONENT </U></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We believe proxy access is a fundamental shareholder right that will make directors more accountable and contribute to
increased shareholder value. The CFA Institute&#146;s 2014 assessment of pertinent academic studies and the use of proxy access in other markets similarly concluded that proxy access: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Would &#147;benefit both the markets and corporate boardrooms, with little cost or disruption.&#148; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Has the potential to raise overall U.S. market capitalization by up to $140.3 billion if adopted market-wide.
(<U>http://www.cfapubs.org/doi/pdf/10.2469/ccb.v2014.n9.1</U>) </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The proposed by-law terms
enjoy strong investor support&#151;votes for similar shareholder proposals averaged 55% from 2012 through September 2014&#151;and similar by-laws have been adopted by companies of various sizes across industries, including Chesapeake Energy,
Hewlett-Packard, Western Union and Verizon. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We urge shareholders to vote FOR this proposal. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>BOARD OF DIRECTORS STATEMENT </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>For the reasons discussed below, the board of directors recommends a vote AGAINST the stockholder proposal at this time. </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The board regularly monitors corporate governance developments such as emerging topics such as proxy access, and will
continue to do so, including through ongoing engagement with the company&#146;s stockholders and reviewing market developments. However, the board believes that a proxy access requirement at this time of the nature contemplated by the
proponent&#146;s proposal is neither in the best interests of the company and its stockholders nor fully reflective of the company&#146;s current corporate governance policies and practices that aim to promote board accountability and provide
stockholders with an equitable platform for expressing their views to the board. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Specifically, the company
has a robust corporate governance framework already in place that is designed to ensure director accountability and enhance stockholders&#146; ability to effectively influence the board, which framework includes the following features and practices:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">the company has an independent, non-executive chairman of the board; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">beginning with the 2016 annual meeting of stockholders, all directors will be elected annually; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">directors are elected by a majority vote standard, with a requirement that directors offer to resign if they fail to receive the requisite number of
votes to be elected; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">13 out of 14 current directors are independent under NYSE rules, and all have highly relevant strategic, operational and financial expertise and are
recognized as leaders in their respective fields; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">78 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">the company has a robust process for regularly reviewing the composition of the board and has had an infusion of a majority of new independent
directors since 2013, including another new independent director appointed to the board just last year; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">stockholders can propose director nominees to the corporate governance and nominating committee which is composed of five independent directors,
three of whom joined the board within the last two years; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">stockholders can communicate directly with the board or with the directors serving on the board (including the independent chairman);
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">stockholders can nominate directors pursuant to the company&#146;s by-laws and solicit proxies for director nominees under federal proxy rules;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">stockholders can submit proposals for consideration at an annual meeting and for inclusion in the company&#146;s proxy statement, subject to certain
conditions and SEC rules; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">stockholders can express their views on the executive compensation program through the annual &#147;say on pay&#148; vote, which is further detailed
in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis on page 27. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Additionally, the company has an
active and ongoing stockholder outreach program through which senior management and members of the board regularly solicit stockholders&#146; views on a number of matters including corporate strategy, board composition, governance policies and
executive compensation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The board believes the company&#146;s existing policies and procedures therefore
ensure board accountability to stockholders, while striking an appropriate balance that also enables the board to oversee the company&#146;s business and affairs effectively and efficiently in order to serve the long-term benefit of the
stockholders. These structures are designed to foster responsiveness to stockholders while allowing the board to devote the time and attention necessary to oversee the execution of the company&#146;s strategy. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The board recommends that you vote against the stockholder&#146;s proxy access proposal at this time because it is not
tailored to the company&#146;s circumstances, undercuts the critical role of the board to promote stockholder interests and risks introducing an unnecessary and potentially harmful dynamic into the board election process. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>The company is committed to continuing to engage with stockholders on corporate governance matters, including proxy
access, and stockholders should not conclude that voting for this proposal is the only or most effective method for conveying their views on proxy access to the board. </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The proponent has submitted a substantially identical version of this proposal to dozens of companies, thereby failing to
draw any distinction between the specific circumstances and governance profiles of each individual company and respective stockholder base. This proposal therefore takes no account of any company-specific circumstances such as market capitalization
or board size, nor of the fact that the company&#146;s corporate governance structures and practices already ensure that the board is accountable to stockholders, and stockholders already have
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">79 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">
several avenues to voice their opinions to, and influence, the board. The board therefore believes that the minimal eligibility requirements and significant proportion of the board availability
for proxy access candidates contemplated by this proposal are disproportionate and inappropriate for a company with existing policies and procedures as robust as the company&#146;s to ensure board accountability to stockholders. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Moreover, there is not a clear consensus among investors and corporate governance experts as to what the appropriate
parameters of a proxy access by-law should be. The board believes it would be imprudent to adopt a proxy access by-law prematurely with the parameters embodied in the stockholder proposal before the company has had the opportunity to solicit the
views of a broad spectrum of the company&#146;s stockholders as to what, if any, would be an appropriate proxy access proposal construct for the company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">With respect to matters of board composition, it is critical to the company&#146;s long-term success that the company nominate and retain qualified directors with deep knowledge of the strategic,
financial and operational aspects of a large, complex, global company, as well as familiarity with the risks associated with operating in the oil and gas industry. In addition, to ensure that the company can access investment opportunities to drive
long-term stockholder value, the company must ensure the stability of long-term relationships with international partners, resource holders and other stakeholders, and a well-functioning board, and orderly board refreshment process is an important
part of having and presenting such stability. Prematurely adopting an inappropriate form of proxy access could undermine the role of the board and the independent corporate governance and nominating committee in the election of directors to the
detriment, rather than benefit, of the stockholders. In this regard, the board believes that an effective board should include individuals with certain personal characteristics and core competencies and an appropriate commitment to the company, and
the overall composition of the board should achieve a complementary balance of talents, skills and experiences, as well as independence and diversity in gender, age, ethnic background, geographic origin and professional experience. In reviewing
these factors, the board acts through the corporate governance and nominating committee, which is composed entirely of independent directors&#151;three of whom joined the board within the last two years&#151;and receives the advice of independent
outside advisors. The committee has a process for identifying and recommending director candidates for election to the board in accordance with criteria developed by the board, as further described in this proxy statement and the company&#146;s
corporate governance guidelines. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">As part of the director nomination process, the independent directors
serving on the corporate governance and nominating committee consider any and all stockholder recommendations for prospective director candidates, as described elsewhere in this proxy statement. The board and corporate governance and nominating
committee are best situated to assess the particular characteristics and qualifications of potential director nominees and determine whether they will contribute to a well-rounded and well-functioning board that operates openly and collaboratively,
provides effective oversight of management and represents the interests of all stockholders, not just those with special interests. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The board also believes that proxy access of the form contemplated by the stockholder proposal may have a number of significant adverse consequences that should be considered. Such
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">80 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">
potential unintended consequences include increasing the influence of special interest groups who may use proxy access to promote specific agendas, lowering the commitment necessary of
stockholders who seek to run proxy contests and unnecessarily increasing the frequency of such contests, discouraging highly qualified director candidates from serving on the board and promoting a short-term strategic and operational focus that
would not be in the interests of long-term stockholders. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The board believes that the current measures the
company employs for the nomination and election of members of the board have led to a board that is responsive to stockholder input and committed to a strategy of long-term value creation. Disruption of the board&#146;s functioning could adversely
affect the pursuit of the board&#146;s long-term strategy and put stockholder value at risk. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For the
foregoing reasons, the board believes that this proposal is unnecessary at this time and is not in the best interests of the stockholders. The board will continue to actively monitor corporate governance trends and practices and engage with
stockholders on such topics, including proxy access. The board will of course take into account the vote on this proposal alongside the views expressed by the stockholders in making any future decisions regarding proxy access. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For these reasons, the board urges stockholders to vote<B>&nbsp;AGAINST</B>&nbsp;this proposal. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">81 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><A NAME="toc859837_16"></A>PROPOSAL 6: STOCKHOLDER PROPOSAL FOR A SCENARIO ANALYSIS REPORT
REGARDING CARBON ASSET RISK </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The company has received notice from the Park Foundation, represented by As
You Sow, 1611 Telegraph Avenue, Suite 1450, Oakland, CA 94612, the Connecticut Retirement Plans and Trust Funds, 55 Elm Street, Hartford, CT 06106-1773, and the Allen Hancock Revocable Living Trust, represented by the First Affirmative Financial
Network, LLC, 5475 Mark Dabling Boulevard, Suite 108, Colorado Springs, Colorado 80918, each of which has continuously held more than $2,000 of the company&#146;s common stock since November&nbsp;24, 2013, of their intention to present the following
resolution for action at the annual meeting. The proponents also furnished the supporting statement immediately following the resolution. Adoption of this proposal requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the shares present in person or
represented by proxy. Abstentions will be counted as present for purposes of this vote and therefore will have the same effect as a vote against this stockholder proposal. Broker non-votes will not be counted as present and are not entitled to vote
on the proposal. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">PROPOSAL FOR CARBON ASSET RISK SCENARIO ANALYSIS REPORT </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">WHEREAS, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Investors require information on how Hess Corporation is preparing for the likelihood that demand for oil and gas may be significantly reduced due to regulation or other climate-associated drivers,
increasing risk for stranding some portion of its reserves. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Recognizing the severe and pervasive risks
associated with a warming climate, global governments have agreed that increases in global temperature should be held below 2 degrees Celsius. To achieve this goal, the International Energy Agency (IEA) states that &#147;No more than one-third of
proven reserves of fossil fuels can be consumed prior to 2050&#133;.&#148; HSBC notes that the equity valuation of oil producers could drop by 40% to 60% under such a low carbon consumption scenario. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">U.S. and China leaders recently signed an historic accord to limit greenhouse gas emissions; European leaders have
committed to a 40% reduction by 2030. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">In addition to the potential for global treaties, oil demand is being
affected by technology innovations, falling renewable energy costs, consumer substitution, and policies related to air quality, fuel efficiency, and lower-carbon energy, cumulatively reducing demand for oil and gas. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">A March 2013 Citi report states that market forces could &#147;put in a plateau for global oil demand by the end of this
decade.&#148; The IEA and Deutsche Bank forecast global oil demand could peak in the next 10 to 15 years. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Industry production costs&#151;and risk&#151;are rising as companies invest in higher cost, higher carbon reserves. Kepler
Cheuvreux declares a &#147;capex crisis,&#148; noting that, since 2005, annual upstream investment for oil has increased by 100%, while crude oil supply has increased by only 3%. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Given the likelihood of slowing demand and increasing costs, Hess&#146; investments in high cost projects, including a
range of deep water projects, are increasingly at risk of stranding. Investors are concerned that Hess is not adequately accounting for these risks. Investors require </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">82 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">
additional information on whether and how the company is preparing for these changing market conditions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">RESOLVED, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Shareholders request Hess to prepare a scenario
analysis report by September 2015, omitting proprietary information, on the Company&#146;s strategy to address the risk of stranded assets presented by global climate change and associated demand reductions for oil and gas, including analysis of
long and short term financial and operational risks to the company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>SUPPORTING STATEMENT FROM STOCKHOLDER PROPONENT
</U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">We recommend the report: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">evaluate a range of low-carbon, low-demand scenarios, including a scenario in which two-thirds of reserves cannot be monetized;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">provide an assessment of different capital allocation strategies for the low-demand scenarios including diversifying capital investment or returning
capital to shareholders; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:WINGDINGS" SIZE="3" COLOR="#000000">&#159;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">provide information on carbon price and crude oil price assumptions used in each scenario. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><U>BOARD OF DIRECTORS STATEMENT </U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B>For the reasons discussed below the board of directors recommends a vote AGAINST the stockholder proposal.</B> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The board has carefully considered this proposal and believes that approval of the proposed resolution is not in the best interest of the company or its stockholders. The company recognizes the
importance, as both an ethical and a business responsibility, of addressing the environmental, social and business impacts of carbon emissions and climate change. To that end, the company publishes an annual sustainability report that details the
company&#146;s policies and strategy relating to corporate sustainability, including detailed discussion of the company&#146;s policies and goals in addressing the risks and opportunities for the company presented by climate change and the changing
market for energy products and services. The company&#146;s most recent annual sustainability report for 2013 is available on the company&#146;s website at <U>www.hess.com</U>. The company&#146;s sustainability report has achieved an A+ in
conformance with the GRI Sustainability Reporting Guidelines and has received recognition for its breadth and quality. In addition, in order to further underscore its commitment to addressing the environmental challenges the company and the energy
industry faces, in 2013 the board established an environmental, health and safety subcommittee of its audit committee to focus and strengthen the board&#146;s oversight of these matters. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">In its 2013 sustainability report, the company specifically addressed the carbon asset risk issue. The report states that
the IEA forecasts that even with rapid growth in renewable energy, fossil fuels will still account for 60% of the world&#146;s energy mix in 2040. The report also explains that more carbon intensive fossil fuels such as coal would likely be more
impacted by restrictive climate policies than light crude oil and natural gas, which comprise the bulk of the company&#146;s reserves. The company believes that governments will choose a more moderate path than that
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">83 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">
envisioned by the proponents, which will allow for economic growth, particularly for developing countries, while mitigating effects of greenhouse gas emissions. Moreover, a recent IHS Energy
carbon asset risk study points out that the financial value of most publicly traded oil and gas companies is based primarily on the valuation of proved reserves, 90% of which are expected to be monetized over the next 10 to 15 years. For these
reasons the company believes that there is not a substantial risk its reserves will not be monetized and that markets are currently valuing carbon assets rationally. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Preparing an additional report on carbon asset risk like the one described by the proponents would require a significant
amount of time and effort on behalf of the company in a relatively brief period of time, without providing our stockholders with commensurate value. Analysis of short-term and long-term financial and operational risks to the company based on the
parameters set forth by the proponents, including a scenario in which two-thirds of reserves cannot be monetized, would be extremely speculative and risks confusing and misleading investors about the company&#146;s actual performance. To the extent
that drastic reductions in greenhouse gas emissions and other environmental trends become material risks to the financial and operational performance of the company, those risks will be addressed in the ordinary course through the company&#146;s
annual reports on Form 10-K and/or other public filings. The company&#146;s 2014 annual report on Form 10-K includes a risk factor addressing the effects of stringent greenhouse gas emission regulations. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">Because the company has already proactively taken the steps to disclose to its stockholders through its sustainability
report its efforts to reduce its operational carbon footprint, as well as its strategy to address changes in the energy market relating to the reduction of carbon emissions and increased focus on renewable energy, the board does not believe it would
be in the best interests of the company to expend significant time and corporate resources to provide the type of additional speculative analysis requested by the proponents. A substantially similar proposal was submitted by the proponents at the
2014 annual meeting and was rejected by a significant margin, with only 8.4% of shares which were voted at the annual meeting voting for the proposal. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">For these reasons, the board urges stockholders to vote <B>AGAINST</B> this proposal. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">84 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><A NAME="toc859837_17"></A>OTHER MATTERS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">The board of directors knows of no other matters to come before the meeting. Should any unanticipated business properly
come before the meeting, the persons named in the enclosed proxy will vote in accordance with their best judgment. The accompanying proxy confers discretionary authority to such persons to vote on any unanticipated matters. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:5%" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><I>It is important that proxies be returned promptly. Stockholders are urged to date and sign the proxy and return it
promptly in the accompanying envelope, or to vote via the internet or by calling the toll-free number as instructed on the proxy card. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">By order of the Board of Directors, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">George C. Barry </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><I>Secretary </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">April&nbsp;2,
2015 </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3">85 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><A NAME="toc859837_18"></A>ANNEX A </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>HESS CORPORATION </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>AMENDED AND RESTATED 2008 LONG-TERM INCENTIVE PLAN </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>[Approved by stockholders on May&nbsp;7, 2008, and incorporating amendments to Section&nbsp;9.02(c) and (d)&nbsp;effective March&nbsp;3,
2010, and amendments to Section&nbsp;4 effective when approved by stockholders on May&nbsp;2, 2012, and Amended and Restated as of March 4,&nbsp;2015, to be effective upon approval of the stockholders at the 2015 annual meeting] </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>SECTION&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Purpose.</B>&nbsp;The purpose of this Amended and Restated 2008 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the
&#147;Plan&#148;) of Hess Corporation (together with any successor thereto, the &#147;Corporation&#148;) is (a)&nbsp;to promote the identity of interests between shareholders of the Corporation and non-employee directors of the Corporation and
officers, other employees and consultants of the Corporation and the Subsidiaries by encouraging and creating significant ownership of Common Stock of the Corporation by such directors, officers, other employees and consultants; (b)&nbsp;to enable
the Corporation and the Subsidiaries to attract and retain qualified officers, other employees, consultants and directors who contribute to the Corporation&#146;s and its Subsidiaries&#146; success by their ability, ingenuity and industry; and
(c)&nbsp;to provide meaningful long-term incentive opportunities for such officers, other employees, consultants and directors who are responsible for the success of the Corporation and the Subsidiaries and who are in a position to make significant
contributions toward their objectives. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>SECTION&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Definitions.</B> In addition to the terms defined
elsewhere in the Plan, the following shall be defined terms under the Plan: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.01&nbsp;&#147;Assumed&#148; where used to describe an Award,
means that, pursuant to a transaction resulting in a Change of Control, either (a)&nbsp;the Award is expressly affirmed by the Corporation or (b)&nbsp;the contractual obligations represented by the Award are expressly (and not merely by operation of
law) assumed by the surviving or successor corporation or entity to the Corporation, or any parent or subsidiary of either thereof, or any other corporation or entity that is a party to the transaction resulting in the Change of Control, in
connection with such Change of Control, with appropriate adjustments to the number and kind of securities of such surviving or successor corporation or entity, or such other applicable parent, subsidiary, corporation or entity, subject to the Award
and the exercise or purchase price thereof, which preserves the compensation element of the Award existing at the time of such Change of Control transaction, and provides for subsequent payout in accordance with the same (or more favorable) payment
and vesting schedule applicable to such Award, as determined in accordance with the instruments evidencing the agreement to assume the Award. The determination of Award comparability for this purpose shall be made by the Committee, and its
determination shall be final, binding and conclusive. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.02 &#147;Award&#148; means any Performance Award, Option, Stock Appreciation
Right, Restricted Stock, Restricted Stock Unit or Dividend Equivalent granted to a Participant under the Plan. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">A-1 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.03&nbsp;&#147;Award Agreement&#148; means any written or electronic agreement, contract, or
other instrument or document evidencing an Award. The Committee may provide for the use of electronic, internet or other non-paper Award Agreements, and the use of electronic, internet or other non-paper means for the acceptance thereof and actions
thereunder by a Participant. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.04&nbsp;&#147;Board&#148; means the Board of Directors of the Corporation. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.05&nbsp;&#147;Cause&#148; means, unless otherwise provided in the Participant&#146;s Award Agreement: (i)&nbsp;a felony conviction of the
Participant or the failure of the Participant to contest prosecution for a felony; (ii)&nbsp;the Participant&#146;s gross and willful misconduct in connection with the performance of the Participant&#146;s duties with the Corporation and/or a
Subsidiary or (iii)&nbsp;the willful and continued failure of the Participant to substantially perform the Participant&#146;s duties with the Corporation after a written demand from the Board or the Committee for substantial performance which
specifically identifies the manner in which the Board or the Committee, as the case may be, believes that the Participant has not performed the Participant&#146;s duties with the Corporation, <U>provided</U> that the event or circumstance described
in clause (i), (ii)&nbsp;or (iii)&nbsp;is directly and materially harmful to the business or reputation of the Corporation or any Subsidiary; <U>provided further</U>, <U>however</U>, that, if at any particular time the Participant is subject to an
effective employment agreement or change in control agreement with the Corporation or a Subsidiary, then, in lieu of the foregoing definition, &#147;Cause&#148; shall at that time have such meaning as may be specified in such employment agreement or
change in control agreement, as applicable. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.06&nbsp;&#147;Change of Control&#148; and related terms are defined in Section&nbsp;9. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.07&nbsp;&#147;Code&#148; means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended from time to time. References to any provision of the Code shall
be deemed to include successor provisions thereto and regulations thereunder. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.08&nbsp;&#147;Committee&#148; means the Compensation and
Management Development Committee of the Board, or such other Board committee as may be designated by the Board to administer the Plan, or any subcommittee of either; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that the Committee, and any subcommittee thereof,
shall consist of three or more directors (or such lesser number as may be permitted by applicable law or rule), each of whom is a &#147;disinterested person&#148; within the meaning of the applicable provisions of Rule&nbsp;16b-3 under the Exchange
Act, is, to the extent that an exception from the deduction limitations of Section&nbsp;162(m) of the Code is sought with respect to Awards, an &#147;outside director&#148; within the meaning of Section&nbsp;162(m)(3)(c) of the Code and Treasury
Regulation&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.162-27(e)(3), as amended from time to time, and satisfies such additional regulatory or listing requirements as the Board may determine to be applicable or appropriate, and any such other criteria of independence as
the Board may establish. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.09&nbsp;&#147;Corporation&#148; is defined in Section&nbsp;1. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.10&nbsp;&#147;Covered Employee&#148; means any Participant who the Committee determines, at the time an Award is granted to such Participant,
is, or may as of the end of the tax year in which the Corporation or a Subsidiary would claim a tax deduction in connection with such Award, a &#147;covered employee&#148; within the meaning of Section&nbsp;162(m) of the Code, and successor
provisions. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">A-2 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.11&nbsp;&#147;Dividend Equivalent&#148; means a right, granted to a Participant under
Section&nbsp;6.03, to receive cash, Shares, other Awards, or other property equal in value to dividends paid with respect to a specified number of Shares. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.12&nbsp;&#147;Exchange Act&#148; means the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended from time to time. References to any provision of the
Exchange Act shall be deemed to include successor provisions thereto and any rules and regulations thereunder. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.13&nbsp;&#147;Fair Market
Value&#148; means, with respect to Shares, Awards, or other property, the fair market value of such Shares, Awards, or other property determined by such methods or procedures as shall be established from time to time by the Committee. Unless
otherwise determined by the Committee, the Fair Market Value of Shares as of any date shall be the closing sales price on that date of a Share as reported in the New York Stock Exchange Composite Transaction Report; <U>provided</U>, that if there
were no sales on the valuation date but there were sales on dates within a reasonable period both before and after the valuation date, the Fair Market Value is the weighted average of the closing prices on the nearest date before and the nearest
date after the valuation date. The average is to be weighted inversely by the respective numbers of trading days between the selling dates and the valuation date. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.14&nbsp;&#147;Good Reason&#148; means, unless otherwise provided in the Participant&#146;s Award Agreement, the occurrence of one or more of
the following events (regardless of whether any other reason, other than Cause, for the Participant&#146;s termination of employment exists or has occurred): (i)&nbsp;failure to elect or reelect or otherwise to maintain the Participant in the office
or the position, or at least a substantially equivalent office or position, of or with the Corporation, which the Participant held immediately prior to the Change of Control, or the removal of the Participant as a director of the Corporation, if the
Participant shall have been a director of the Corporation immediately prior to the Change of Control; (ii)&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;any material adverse change in the nature or scope of the Participant&#146;s authorities, powers, functions, responsibilities or
duties from those in effect immediately prior to the Change of Control, (B)&nbsp;a reduction in the Participant&#146;s annual base salary rate, (C)&nbsp;a reduction in the Participant&#146;s annual incentive compensation target or any material
reduction in the Participant&#146;s other bonus opportunities or (D)&nbsp;the termination or denial of the Participant&#146;s ability to participate in employee welfare benefits, including travel accident, major medical, dental care and other
welfare benefit programs, substantially similar to those in effect immediately prior to the Change of Control, or, if greater, to those that the Participant was receiving or entitled to receive immediately prior to the date of his or her termination
of employment with the Corporation or a Subsidiary (or, if greater, immediately prior to any such termination or denial), or in the Corporation&#146;s Employees&#146; Pension Plan or Pension Restoration Plan or other supplemental pension plan in
effect as of the date of the Change of Control, or a material reduction in the scope or value thereof, any of which is not remedied by the Corporation within ten (10)&nbsp;days after receipt by the Corporation of written notice from the Participant
of such change, reduction or termination, as the case may be; (iii)&nbsp;the Corporation requires the Participant to change the Participant&#146;s principal location of work to a location that is in excess of thirty (30)&nbsp;miles from the location
thereof immediately prior to the Change of Control, or requires the Participant to travel in the course of discharging the Participant&#146;s responsibilities or duties at least 20% more (in terms of aggregate days in any calendar year or in any
calendar quarter when annualized </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">A-3 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
for purposes of comparison to any prior year) than was required of the Participant in any of the three full years immediately prior to the Change of Control without, in either case, the
Participant&#146;s prior written consent; or (iv)&nbsp;if at any particular time the Participant is subject to an effective employment agreement or change in control agreement with the Corporation or a Subsidiary, (A)&nbsp;the liquidation,
dissolution, merger, consolidation or reorganization of the Corporation or transfer of all or substantially all of its business and/or assets, unless the successor or successors (by liquidation, merger, consolidation, reorganization, transfer or
otherwise) to which all or substantially all of its businesses and/or assets have been transferred (directly or by operation of law), by agreement in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to the Participant, expressly assumed and agreed to
perform all duties and obligations of the Corporation or such Subsidiary under such agreement in the same manner and to the same extent that the Corporation or such Subsidiary would be required to so perform if no such succession had taken place or
(B)&nbsp;without limiting the generality or effect of the foregoing, any material breach of such agreement by the Corporation or such Subsidiary, which breach is not remedied within ten (10)&nbsp;days after written notice to the Corporation from the
Participant describing the nature of such breach. The foregoing to the contrary notwithstanding, if at any particular time the Participant is subject to an effective employment agreement or change in control agreement with the Corporation or a
Subsidiary, then, in lieu of the foregoing definition, &#147;Good Reason&#148; shall at that time have such meaning as may be specified in such employment agreement or change in control agreement, as applicable. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.15&nbsp;&#147;Immediate Family Member&#148; means, with respect to any Participant, any of such Participant&#146;s spouse, children, parents
or siblings. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.16&nbsp;&#147;Incentive Stock Option&#148; means an Option that is intended to meet the requirements of Section&nbsp;422 of
the Code. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.17 &#147;Non-Qualified Stock Option&#148; means an Option that is not intended to be an Incentive Stock Option. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.18&nbsp;&#147;Option&#148; means a right, granted to a Participant under Section&nbsp;6.06, to purchase Shares at a specified price during
specified time periods. An Option may be either an Incentive Stock Option or a Non-Qualified Stock Option. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.19&nbsp;&#147;Participant&#148; means an eligible person who has been granted an Award under the Plan. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.20&nbsp;&#147;Performance Award&#148; means a right, granted to a Participant under Section&nbsp;6.02, to receive cash, Shares, other Awards,
or other property the payment of which is contingent upon achievement of performance goals specified by the Committee. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.21&nbsp;&#147;Performance-Based Restricted Stock&#148; means Restricted Stock that is subject to a risk of forfeiture if specified
performance goals are not met within the restriction period. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.22&nbsp;&#147;Performance-Based Restricted Stock Unit&#148; means a
Restricted Stock Unit that is subject to forfeiture if specified performance criteria are not met within the restriction period. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.23&nbsp;&#147;Plan&#148; is defined in Section&nbsp;1. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">A-4 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.24&nbsp;&#147;Replaced,&#148; where used to describe an Award, means that pursuant to a
transaction resulting in a Change of Control, the Award is replaced with a comparable stock award or a cash incentive program by the Corporation, the surviving or successor corporation or entity to the Corporation, or any parent or subsidiary of
either thereof, or any other corporation or entity that is a party to the transaction resulting in the Change of Control, in connection with such Change of Control, which preserves the compensation element of the Award existing at the time of such
Change of Control transaction, and provides for subsequent payout in accordance with the same (or more favorable) payment and vesting schedule applicable to such Award, as determined in accordance with the instruments evidencing the agreement to
replace the Award. The determination of Award comparability for this purpose shall be made by the Committee, and its determination shall be final, binding and conclusive. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.25 &#147;Restricted Stock&#148; means Shares granted to a Participant under Section&nbsp;6.04, that are subject to certain restrictions and
to a risk of forfeiture. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.26&nbsp;&#147;Restricted Stock Units&#148; means a right, granted to a Participant under Section&nbsp;6.05, to
receive Shares, a cash payment determined by reference to the then-current Fair Market Value of Shares or a combination of Shares and such cash payment (as the Committee shall determine) at the end of a specified restriction period. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.27&nbsp;&#147;Rule&nbsp;16b-3&#148; means Rule&nbsp;16b-3, as from time to time amended and applicable to Participants, promulgated by the
Securities and Exchange Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;) under Section&nbsp;16 of the Exchange Act. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.28&nbsp;&#147;Shares&#148; means the
Common Stock, $1.00&nbsp;par value per share, of the Corporation and such other securities of the Corporation as may be substituted for Shares or such other securities pursuant to Section&nbsp;10. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.29&nbsp;&#147;Special Restricted Stock Units&#148; means Restricted Stock Units granted under Subsection 6.05(i)(b), subject to the maximum
Share limitation set forth in Section&nbsp;7.02.3. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.30&nbsp;&#147;Special Restricted Stock&#148; means Restricted Stock granted under
Subsection 6.04(i)(b), subject to the maximum Share limitation set forth in Section&nbsp;7.02.3. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.31&nbsp;&#147;Stock Appreciation
Right&#148; means a right, granted to a Participant under Section&nbsp;6.07, to be paid an amount measured by the appreciation in the Fair Market Value of Shares from the date of grant to the date of exercise of the right, with payment to be made in
cash, Shares, other Awards, or other property as specified in the Award or determined by the Committee. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.32&nbsp;&#147;Subsidiary&#148;
means any corporation (other than the Corporation) with respect to which the Corporation owns, directly or indirectly, 50% or more of the total combined voting power for all classes of stock. In addition, any other related entity may be designated
by the Board or the Committee as a Subsidiary, provided the Board or the Committee determines that the Corporation has a substantial ownership interest in such entity; and <U>provided further</U> that any such determination shall be made taking into
account, without limitation, Sections&nbsp;409A and 422 of the Code, as applicable. The foregoing to the contrary notwithstanding, for purposes of Incentive Stock Options, &#147;Subsidiary&#148; means any present or future corporation which is or
would be a &#147;subsidiary corporation&#148; of the Corporation as such term is defined in Section&nbsp;424(f) of the Code. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">A-5 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.33&nbsp;&#147;Substitute Awards&#148; has the meaning given such term in Section&nbsp;7.03.
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.34&nbsp;&#147;Year&#148; means a calendar year. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>SECTION&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Administration.</B> </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">3.01&nbsp;<I>Authority of the Committee.&nbsp;</I>The Plan shall be administered by the Committee. The Committee shall have full and final
authority to take the following actions, in each case subject to and consistent with the provisions of the Plan: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(i)&nbsp;to select and
designate Participants; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(ii)&nbsp;to designate Subsidiaries; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(iii)&nbsp;to determine the type or types of Awards to be granted to each Participant; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(iv)&nbsp;to determine the number of Awards to be granted, the number of Shares to which an Award will relate, the terms and conditions of any
Award granted under the Plan (including, but not limited to, any exercise price, grant price, or purchase price, any restriction or condition, any schedule for lapse of restrictions or conditions relating to transferability or forfeiture,
exercisability, or settlement of an Award, and waivers or accelerations thereof, and waiver of performance conditions relating to an Award, based in each case on such considerations as the Committee shall determine), and all other matters to be
determined in connection with an Award; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(v)&nbsp;to determine whether, to what extent, and under what circumstances an Award may be
settled, or the exercise price of an Award may be paid, in cash, Shares, other Awards, or other property, or an Award may be cancelled, forfeited, or surrendered; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(vi)&nbsp;to determine whether, to what extent, and under what circumstances cash, Shares, other Awards, or other property payable with respect
to an Award will be deferred either automatically, at the election of the Committee, or pursuant to an agreement between the Corporation and the Participant; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(vii)&nbsp;to prescribe the form of each Award Agreement, which need not be identical for each Participant; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(viii)&nbsp;to adopt, amend, suspend, waive, and rescind such rules and regulations and appoint such agents as the Committee may deem necessary
or advisable to administer the Plan; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(ix)&nbsp;to interpret the Plan and the Award Agreements hereunder, with such interpretations to be
conclusive and binding on all persons and otherwise accorded the maximum deference permitted by law; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(x)&nbsp;to correct any defect or
supply any omission or reconcile any inconsistency in the Plan and to construe and interpret the Plan and any Award, rules and regulations, Award Agreement, or other instrument hereunder;&nbsp;and </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(xi)&nbsp;to take all other actions and make all other decisions and determinations as may be required under the terms of the Plan or as the
Committee may deem necessary or advisable for the administration of the Plan. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">A-6 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">3.02&nbsp;<I>Manner of Exercise of Committee Authority.&nbsp;</I>Unless authority is specifically
reserved to the Board under the terms of the Plan, or applicable law, the Committee shall have sole discretion in exercising such authority under the Plan. Any action of the Committee with respect to the Plan shall be final, conclusive, and binding
on all persons, including the Corporation, Subsidiaries, Participants, any person claiming any rights under the Plan from or through any Participant, and shareholders. The express grant of any specific power to the Committee, and the taking of any
action by the Committee, shall not be construed as limiting any power or authority of the Committee. The Committee may, to the extent permissible under applicable law, delegate to officers or managers of the Corporation or any Subsidiary the
authority, subject to such terms as the Committee shall determine, to perform administrative functions under the Plan. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman">3.03&nbsp;<I>Limitation of Liability.&nbsp;</I>Each member of the Committee shall be entitled to, in good faith, rely or act upon any report
or other information furnished to him by any officer or other employee of the Corporation or any Subsidiary, the Corporation&#146;s independent certified public accountants, or any consultant or other professional retained by the Corporation to
assist in the administration of the Plan. No member of the Committee, nor any officer or employee of the Corporation acting on behalf of the Committee, shall be personally liable for any action, determination, or interpretation taken or made in good
faith with respect to the Plan, and all members of the Committee and any officer or employee of the Corporation acting on their behalf, shall, to the extent permitted by law, be fully indemnified and protected by the Corporation with respect to any
such action, determination, or interpretation. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:12pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>SECTION&nbsp;4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Shares Subject to the Plan.</B>&nbsp;The shares
of stock subject to Awards granted under the Plan shall be Shares. Shares subject to the Plan may be either authorized and unissued shares (which will not be subject to preemptive rights) or previously issued shares acquired by the Corporation or
any Subsidiary. Subject to adjustment as provided in Section&nbsp;10, the total number of Shares reserved and available for Awards under the Plan during the term hereof shall be (a)&nbsp;38,000,000 Shares, <U>plus</U> (b)&nbsp;up to 2,864,875 Shares
subject to outstanding stock options or other awards under the Hess Corporation Second Amended and Restated 1995 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the &#147;Prior Plan&#148;) to the extent that on or after March&nbsp;24, 2015, such stock options or other
awards are forfeited or such a stock option or other award is settled or terminates without a distribution of Shares (whether or not cash, other awards or other property is distributed with respect to such stock option or other award) (the
&#147;Share Reserve&#148;). For purposes of this Section&nbsp;4, (a)&nbsp;each Share delivered pursuant to an Option shall reduce the Share Reserve by one (1)&nbsp;Share; (b)&nbsp;each Share subject to the exercised portion of a SAR shall reduce the
Share Reserve by one (1)&nbsp;Share, such that the total number of Shares with respect to which such SAR is exercised shall reduce the Share Reserve by an equal number of Shares; (c)&nbsp;each Share delivered pursuant to a Restricted Stock Unit
Award, a Dividend Equivalent paid in Shares, or a Performance Award shall reduce the Share Reserve by two (2)&nbsp;Shares; (d)&nbsp;each Share delivered pursuant to a Restricted Stock Award without a purchase price, or with a per-Share purchase
